llm_text:
Why:
- payment_format_ach = 1 (SHAP +2.88153, direction: increase) — the payment being ACH is the single largest driver pushing the model score upward.
- amount_received = 14962.8 (SHAP +0.830828, direction: increase) — the receiving amount materially increased the flag likelihood.
- amount_paid = 14962.8 (SHAP +0.760081, direction: increase) — the paid amount also increased the score; note both amount_received and amount_paid are the same numeric value in the drivers.
- dayofweek = 6 (SHAP +0.740754, direction: increase) — the transaction occurring on day 6 (Sunday) contributed to the higher score.

Conclusion:
- The model flagged this transaction primarily because it is an ACH transfer (payment_format_ach) combined with relatively large, equal amounts (amount_received and amount_paid = 14962.8) that together with the Sunday timing (dayofweek = 6) raised the risk score.  
- Based solely on these drivers, a focused review of the ACH payment and counterparty details is warranted; this assessment is conditional on and limited to the named features above.
